As the result of a recent acquisition, a program has been initiated to integrate people, processes and technologies into one organization. At present, the focus is on stabilizing both environments to enable people and process integration activities in the upcoming months.

Initially, the Process Analyst will work with business managers to stabilize functions and processes that lack efficiency and/or effectiveness. This activity will include analysis of current state processes and identification of quick win opportunities to improve overall operations. Once stability is achieved across both legacy organizations, the Process Analyst will then focus on process integration.

During the integration phase, the Process Analyst will leverage their strong facilitation and analytical skills, as well as their Lean Six Sigma and Project Management disciplines, to facilitate the amalgamation of business processes across the two legacy organizations. The Process Analyst will support the creation of future state implementation plans, including a mechanism to collect process performance data, to ensure the successful transition of people, process and technology. Process optimization and performance measurement are key focus areas.

Phase 1 - Process Stabilization
Facilitate cross-functional Kaizen sessions to identify quick win opportunities to improve current state legacy processes
Build strong and trusting relationships with business leads to empower and encourage them to challenge the status quo and to identify and implement quick win opportunities within their areas
Consciously encourage a continuous improvement culture by instilling Process Owner role and accountabilities in business leads
Assess the potential challenges/risks with the implementation of process changes and work with business leads to identify and implement change management tactics to ensure successful adoption
Support the implementation of quick win improvement opportunities by holding business leads accountable to implementation dates
Effectively document and report progress and status of process stabilization initiatives

Objectively facilitate complex cross-functional process design sessions to streamline and re-engineer the core business processes of two legacy organizations; build and document recommendations for an integrated future state design
Analyze current state processes and guide/influence Process Owners to adopt process improvement opportunities that result in the reduction of costs, decrease in process cycle time, and improvements in quality/customer satisfaction
Document process improvement workshop output to effectively illustrate future state processes and to identify and capture improvement and measurement opportunities
Gather and analyze process data to identify process performance areas, future state metrics and to establish a process performance baseline
Guide the solution proposal and business case process and ensure the cost/benefit process improvement and optimization opportunities/recommendations identified in process design workshops are clearly documented
Prepare and support the presentation of process design/improvement summary reports to internal stakeholder groups
Utilize effective Project Management skills to build and manage future state process implementation plans
Provide support to the Change Management team to ensure change strategies and tactics are efficiently implemented
Support the project team with proactive improvements to the existing process improvement methodology and ad hoc requests as required
